[{'created': '2019-08-20 02:38:39.000000000', 'message': "Fix 'has_calls' method calls in unit tests

The 'has_calls' method does not exist in assertion methods of mock.
Replace the 'has_calls' method with an 'assert_has_calls' method or
an 'assert_called_once_with' method.
Add an 'assertEqual' check before an 'assert_has_calls' method.

Conflicts:
    nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_mgr.py

in stable/rocky.

commit_message:
Fix 'has_calls' method calls in unit tests

The 'has_calls' method does not exist in assertion methods of mock.
Replace the 'has_calls' method with an 'assert_has_calls' method or
an 'assert_called_once_with' method.
Add an 'assertEqual' check before an 'assert_has_calls' method.

Conflicts:
    nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_mgr.py

NOTE(takashin): The conflict is due to not having the following change
in stable/rocky.

    Ic062446e5c620c89aec3065b34bcdc6bf5966275

Change-Id: I4b606fce473d064b9bb00213696c075cea020aaf
Closes-Bug: #1840200
(cherry picked from commit ad482e53fbb956288e73692f6bff5f74d862fe5d)
(cherry picked from commit fa59033c40745febc26399e668ceb9911f8ec45d)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-08 15:08:49.000000000', 'message': 'Fix rebuild of baremetal instance when vm_state is ERROR

Nova allows rebuild of instance when vm_state is ERROR. [1]

The vm_state is restored to ACTIVE only after a successful build.
This means rebuilding a baremetal instance using the Ironic driver
is impossible because wait_for_active fails if vm_state=ERROR is found.

This is a regression introduced in a previous change which added
the ability to delete an instance in spawning state. [2]

This present change will skip the abort installation logic
if task_state is REBUILD_SPAWNING while preserving the previous logic.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1183946
[2] https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1455000

Change-Id: I857ad7264f1a7ef1263d8a9d4eca491d6c8dce0f
Closes-bug: #1735009
(cherry picked from commit 1819718e798fb904644391badc3beb40c181ac39)
(cherry picked from commit c21cbf296495b0604cc995d5d17ed164ae8562c5)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix rebuild of baremetal instance when vm_state is ERROR

Nova allows rebuild of instance when vm_state is ERROR. [1]

The vm_state is restored to ACTIVE only after a successful build.
This means rebuilding a baremetal instance using the Ironic driver
is impossible because wait_for_active fails if vm_state=ERROR is found.

This is a regression introduced in a previous change which added
the ability to delete an instance in spawning state. [2]

This present change will skip the abort installation logic
if task_state is REBUILD_SPAWNING while preserving the previous logic.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1183946
[2] https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1455000

Change-Id: I857ad7264f1a7ef1263d8a9d4eca491d6c8dce0f
Closes-bug: #1735009
(cherry picked from commit 1819718e798fb904644391badc3beb40c181ac39)
(cherry picked from commit c21cbf296495b0604cc995d5d17ed164ae8562c5)

[{'created': '2019-08-04 08:37:28.000000000', 'message': 'Implement separate db per tenancy

At present, all time series are accumulated in the same database in
InfluxDB. This makes queries slow for tenants that have less data. This
option enables the option to use separate database per tenancy.

This task implements the changes on monasca-api which handles read
requests to InfluxDB database.

Change-Id: I7de6e0faf069b889d3953583b29a876c3d82c62c
Story: 2006331
Task: 36073

commit_message:
Implement separate db per tenancy

At present, all time series are accumulated in the same database in
InfluxDB. This makes queries slow for tenants that have less data. This
patch enables the option to use separate database per tenancy.

This changeset implements the changes on monasca-api which handles read
requests to InfluxDB database.

It also updates the relevant docs providing link to the migration tool
which enables users to migrate their existing data to a database per
tenant model.

Change-Id: I7de6e0faf069b889d3953583b29a876c3d82c62c
Story: 2006331
Task: 36073

commit_message:
helm-toolkit fix dependency resolver

Fixes an issue where dependencies are leaking from one resource to
another by ensuring that `envAll.Values.__dep` is reset each time.

Change-Id: I34a4b2fa70d608b2c69bdf18275e439f96976229
Closes-Bug: #1845538

commit_message:
Update master for stable/train

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/train.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/train.

Change-Id: I804690a59489084edfebd6f3c140d661b9b193a4
Sem-Ver: feature

commit_message:
Fix monasca-grafana - pin rake to <13

Rake 13.0.0 (released today) depends on Ruby 2.2, but CentOS 7 only
provides Ruby 2.0.

This change pins rake in the monasca-grafana image to versions earlier
than 13.0.0.

Change-Id: Id9a76f459aff016fbc920370c0a3ec58e0397fcb
Closes-Bug: #1845647

commit_message:
Resolve missing parenthesis causing variable exception

This change adds the missing parenthesis. Without this change, whenever
someone attempst to use login credentials it will result in a stack
trace.

Change-Id: I7c7312119e8062ef8344ac7f35adb7da98fbc6e1
Resolves: rhbz#1753676
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Tool to migrate existing data to db per tenant

At present, all time series are accumulated in the same database in
InfluxDB. Separate database per tenant would make queries faster for
tenants. It would also allow administrators to define retention policy
per tenancy.

This changeset adds a migration tool and a guide to allow users to
migrate existing data to a database per tenant.

Task: 36435
Story: 2006331

Change-Id: I3faf3d96b1121c8b8c383dee2fda27d34af5c853

subject: [Stein] Optional flag file for tripleo-transfer to prevent overwriting
messages: [{'account_id': 8042, 'date': '2019-09-26 07:55:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2019-09-27 01:50:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-26 07:55:26.000000000', 'message': '[Stein] Optional flag file for tripleo-transfer to prevent overwriting

When using tripleo-transfer role, optionally a file will be created at
a path specified by tripleo_tranfer_flag_file variable (if set). The
transfer will be prevented in case the file already exists. This is to
ensure the data transfer happens only once and the data is not
overwritten by accident.

The corresponding change I3a08949436dcb634df34622c9aeead552dd38443 for
master branch has to go to tripleo-ansible repo.

Change-Id: I6176e3c9998d8b03d927d1741a1af2946bf2588d
Partial-Bug: #1831690
'}]
commit_message:
[Stein] Optional flag file for tripleo-transfer to prevent overwriting

When using tripleo-transfer role, optionally a file will be created at
a path specified by tripleo_tranfer_flag_file variable (if set). The
transfer will be prevented in case the file already exists. This is to
ensure the data transfer happens only once and the data is not
overwritten by accident.

The corresponding change I3a08949436dcb634df34622c9aeead552dd38443 for
master branch has to go to tripleo-ansible repo.

Change-Id: I6176e3c9998d8b03d927d1741a1af2946bf2588d
Partial-Bug: #1831690

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-31 16:03:29.000000000', 'message': "ec2: Pre-move cleanup of utils

Since most of these functions only have a single caller now, we're going
to move them to their call site. Prepare for that by fixing some issues:

- The 'image_ec2_id' and 'glance_id_to_id' functions were unnecessarily
  split out and are now folded back in
- The 'id_to_ec2_inst_id' function now takes a 'context' argument rather
  than having to retrieve an admin context from scratch

Change-Id: I48250eb573134e5bd0c183edaf07a8d685573c68
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
"}, {'created': '2019-06-05 17:17:39.000000000', 'message': "ec2: Pre-move cleanup of utils

Since most of these functions only have a single caller now, we're going
to move them to their call site. Prepare for that by fixing some issues:

commit_message:
ec2: Pre-move cleanup of utils

Since most of these functions only have a single caller now, we're going
to move them to their call site. Prepare for that by fixing some issues:

- The 'image_ec2_id' function was unnecessarily split out and are now
  folded back in
- The 'id_to_ec2_inst_id' function now takes a 'context' argument rather
  than having to retrieve an admin context from scratch

Change-Id: I48250eb573134e5bd0c183edaf07a8d685573c68
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-25 14:41:17.000000000', 'message': 'Stop silently ignoring invalid 'nova boot --hint' options

The '--hint' option for 'nova boot' expects a key-value pair like so:

  nova boot --hint group=245e1dfe-2d0e-4139-80a9-fce124948896 ...

However, the command doesn't complain if this isn't the case, meaning
typos like the below aren't indicated to the user:

  nova boot --hint 245e1dfe-2d0e-4139-80a9-fce124948896

Due to how we'd implemented this here, this ultimately results in us
POSTing the following as part of the body to 'os-servers':

  {
    ...
    "OS-SCH-HNT:scheduler_hints": {
      "245e1dfe-2d0e-4139-80a9-fce124948896": null
    }
    ...
  }

Which is unfortunately allowed and ignored by nova due to the use of
'additionalProperties' in the schema [1]

Do what we do for loads of other options and explicitly fail on invalid
values.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/19.0.0/nova/api/openstack/compute/schemas/servers.py#L142-L146

Change-Id: I0f9f75cba68e7582d32d4aab2f8f077b4360d386
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
'}, {'created': '2019-09-27 12:06:25.000000000', 'message': 'Stop silently ignoring invalid 'nova boot --hint' options

The '--hint' option for 'nova boot' expects a key-value pair like so:

  nova boot --hint group=245e1dfe-2d0e-4139-80a9-fce124948896 ...

However, the command doesn't complain if this isn't the case, meaning
typos like the below aren't indicated to the user:

  nova boot --hint 245e1dfe-2d0e-4139-80a9-fce124948896

Due to how we'd implemented this here, this ultimately results in us
POSTing the following as part of the body to 'os-servers':

  {
    ...
    "OS-SCH-HNT:scheduler_hints": {
      "245e1dfe-2d0e-4139-80a9-fce124948896": null
    }
    ...
  }

Which is unfortunately allowed and ignored by nova due to the use of
'additionalProperties' in the schema [1]

Do what we do for loads of other options and explicitly fail on invalid
values.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/19.0.0/nova/api/openstack/compute/schemas/servers.py#L142-L146

Change-Id: I0f9f75cba68e7582d32d4aab2f8f077b4360d386
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1845322
'}]
commit_message:
Stop silently ignoring invalid 'nova boot --hint' options

The '--hint' option for 'nova boot' expects a key-value pair like so:

  nova boot --hint group=245e1dfe-2d0e-4139-80a9-fce124948896 ...

However, the command doesn't complain if this isn't the case, meaning
typos like the below aren't indicated to the user:

  nova boot --hint 245e1dfe-2d0e-4139-80a9-fce124948896

Due to how we'd implemented this here, this ultimately results in us
POSTing the following as part of the body to 'os-servers':

  {
    ...
    "OS-SCH-HNT:scheduler_hints": {
      "245e1dfe-2d0e-4139-80a9-fce124948896": null
    }
    ...
  }

Which is unfortunately allowed and ignored by nova due to the use of
'additionalProperties' in the schema [1]

Do what we do for loads of other options and explicitly fail on invalid
values.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/19.0.0/nova/api/openstack/compute/schemas/servers.py#L142-L146

Change-Id: I0f9f75cba68e7582d32d4aab2f8f077b4360d386
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1845322

os-url doesn't work/exist in 4.0.0.

commit_message:
Use os-endpoint instead of os-url for functional tests

The functional tests use an explicit endpoint and token for auth
to the placement fixture. Before openstack client 4.0.0 os-url
was a way to specify the endpoint. Now os-endpoint is the way.

Update accordingly.

Note that this doesn't impact the behavior of the plugin itself,
just the tests.

Change-Id: Id4f8f0224f61c1741e6a1a8369ec053bb1824e8a
(cherry picked from commit f49b9fcc81918ca937ed7332702432c3f82eb639)

commit_message:
DVR: Cleanup ml2 dvr portbindings on migration

When a DVR router is migrated from distributed to
centralized, we are unbinding the router from the
agents, but the ml2 distributed portbindings for
the router port still remains intact.

This patch will fix the issue by deleting the
binding entry for multiple hosts.

Closes-Bug: #1718345
Change-Id: If139790eb336ff13b07b094151946af30322ad3e
(cherry picked from commit 32bfc3edeca935fc9c16b3019aa0af3091cd19e7)

commit_message:
DVR: Cleanup ml2 dvr portbindings on migration

When a DVR router is migrated from distributed to
centralized, we are unbinding the router from the
agents, but the ml2 distributed portbindings for
the router port still remains intact.

This patch will fix the issue by deleting the
binding entry for multiple hosts.

Closes-Bug: #1718345
Change-Id: If139790eb336ff13b07b094151946af30322ad3e
(cherry picked from commit 32bfc3edeca935fc9c16b3019aa0af3091cd19e7)

If I understand correctly. This patch is to cover the following case:

Say we have 144 cores on the server. We want the first 8 cores are used for platform and other core are for other workload such as pmd threads, libvirt. We need to isolate these workload cores so that no other processes will be scheduled on them. On this situation, you also limit the K8S pod on platform cores by setting 'cgroupRoot'.

Based on these configuration, the pmd threads can't run on any cores more than the platform cores. So we are breaking out the cgroup set by K8S, right?"}, {'account_id': 29668, 'date': '2019-09-11 06:08:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

[{'created': '2019-08-30 00:16:05.000000000', 'message': 'ovs-dpdk: create cgroups based on PMD & LCORE CPUMASK

Setup Cgroups to use to break out of Kubernetes defined groups for
ovs-dpdk cpus. The CPUs to use for ovs-dpdk shall be derived from the
intersection of following:-

1. Union of PMD-CPU-MASK & LCORE-MASK confiured by user, and,
2. CPUs not in isolcpus

Change-Id: Ia840647e3fc09480b826b3075b2585daefa638b3

commit_message:
ovs-dpdk: create separate cgroup for openvswitch-vswitchd pods

Setup Cgroup to use to break out of Kubernetes defined groups for ovs-dpdk pods.
All the cores on the server are added to the cpuset, pmd_cpu_mask and lcore_mask
will choose the right ones for ovs-dpdk from all the cores.

Co-Authored-By: Phil Sphicas <ps3910@att.com>

Change-Id: Ia840647e3fc09480b826b3075b2585daefa638b3

This patchset implements policy overrides for neutron-gateway. It uses
the code in charmhelpers.

This change includes a charm-helpers sync to bring in the policyd helper
code.

Note there are no functional tests for this feature as the charm still
uses the old style non-zaza amulet framework.  The Related-Bug below is
tracking this issue.

Change-Id: Iaa697958bafe33e8334e42040cedee07acaac81b
Closes-Bug: #1741723
Related-Bug: #1845639
'}]
commit_message:
Policyd override implementation

This patchset implements policy overrides for neutron-gateway. It uses
the code in charmhelpers.

This change includes a charm-helpers sync to bring in the policyd helper
code.

Note there are no functional tests for this feature as the charm still
uses the old style non-zaza amulet framework.  The Related-Bug below is
tracking this issue.

Change-Id: Iaa697958bafe33e8334e42040cedee07acaac81b
Closes-Bug: #1741723
Related-Bug: #1845639

commit_message:
Add new parameter options to Octavia service

This patch adds three new parameters:

1. OctaviaConnectionMaxRetries
2. OctaviaBuildActiveRetries
3. OctaviaPortDetachTimeout

The default values are same as in octavia and puppet-octavia master
branches as of now.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/682636/
Change-Id: Id5f7bb2160215170561f39015ddfdb93cba904b5

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-25 11:47:02.000000000', 'message': 'Google backup: correct string encoding between py 2 and 3

Correcting encode() and decode() methods of 8-bit and Unicode
string objects.

In Python 2, Both 8-bit and Unicode strings had both methods
and the type of the return value was based on the specific
encoding passed in.

In Python 3, Text strings only have an encode() method, and
that method can only be used with codecs that produce bytes
objects. Similarly bytes and bytearray objects only have a
decode() method which can only be used with codecs that
produce string objects.

Change-Id: I214a786858655b8caf9612f3da5403c7d0bb7387
Closes-Bug: #1831735
(cherry picked from commit 38d581996b436bae9f294be9b030a8e1c427f1a6)
'}]
commit_message:
Google backup: correct string encoding between py 2 and 3

Correcting encode() and decode() methods of 8-bit and Unicode
string objects.

In Python 2, Both 8-bit and Unicode strings had both methods
and the type of the return value was based on the specific
encoding passed in.

In Python 3, Text strings only have an encode() method, and
that method can only be used with codecs that produce bytes
objects. Similarly bytes and bytearray objects only have a
decode() method which can only be used with codecs that
produce string objects.

Change-Id: I214a786858655b8caf9612f3da5403c7d0bb7387
Closes-Bug: #1831735
(cherry picked from commit 38d581996b436bae9f294be9b030a8e1c427f1a6)

commit_message:
Update READMEs for sample policy/config generation

Add a combined README for config generation and replace references to
nova for policy generation.

Change-Id: I3e5fe46f1a63f929e7a73b454507c287574fb83a
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

subject: Add network policy nonvoting checks

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-11 16:57:16.000000000', 'message': 'Create netpol-compute-kit gate

This change adds a network-policy gate, as well as multiple
scripts that provide the appropriate overrides for enabling
network policy in each OpenStack service.

Note that the policies are all currently allow all traffic. Each
service will have their whitelisted rule list specified in
future changes. This gate also does not contain ceph/cinder, which
will be added in another change.

Change-Id: Ide2998ebb2af2832f24ca7abc398a82e4a6d70e3
'}, {'created': '2019-09-11 17:10:09.000000000', 'message': 'Create network policy gates

for cinder/ceph, to test network policy for each OpenStack
service.

Note that the policies are all currently allow all traffic. Each
service will have their whitelisted rule list specified in
future changes.

commit_message:
Add network policy nonvoting checks

This change adds two network policy zuul checks, one for the compute-kit,
and one for cinder/ceph, to test network policy for each OpenStack
service. These checks will be non-voting initially.

The network policy rules for each service will initially allow all
traffic. These ingress/egress rules will be defined in future changes
to only explicitly allow traffic between services that are explicitly
allowed to communicate, other traffic will be denied.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/685130/

Change-Id: Ide2998ebb2af2832f24ca7abc398a82e4a6d70e3

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/train

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/train branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I68c1d467b62539f75348d2b29c1f846cf8ddef69

commit_message:
Explicitly unset console_access_protocol

If console_access_protocol was switched to none then
console_access_protocol was not set at all by the relation set
acting on the relation with the compute nodes. This meant the
operator had no mechanism to unset console_access_protocol. This
change explicitly unsets it so the change is passed to the
compute units.

Change-Id: Ifdca0ec6626732ee0ea30a6847130ea97478df6f
Closes-Bug: #1844356

commit_message:
Pin -python-cinderclient <5.0.0

Recently, python-cinderclient released a new version at 5.0.0.  This
removes the v1 client, which the tests currently rely on.  This patch
pins the client in nova-cc until the tests are upgraded.

Change-Id: I07c9b81eb1b6cc78bf92100b602452acd47da656
Related-Bug: #1845654

commit_message:
Use global request id for scenario tests

This patch adds a global request id to each header for blazar requests
used in the scenario tests. Now the global request ids are in the debug
logs, which helps you to track each request over multiple OpenStack
services improving the debuggability for test failures.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/670995/
Change-Id: Idd7095fa0c7af4b29a5a84b035fe1e882b995fa0

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-20 04:38:11.000000000', 'message': "Remove mox in unit/network/test_neutronv2.py (22)

Replace mox with mock in the following methods
in the TestNeutronv2 class
in nova/tests/unit/network/test_neutronv2.py
and moves the methods to the TestNeutronv2WithMock class.

* test_get_port_vnic_info_multi_segment
* test_get_port_vnic_info_vlan_with_multi_segment_ext
* test_get_port_vnic_info_multi_segment_no_phynet
* test_get_port_vnic_info_1
* _test_get_port_vnic_info
* test_get_port_vnic_info_2
* test_get_port_vnic_info_3

Then the TestNeutronv2 class is removed and
the TestNeutronv2WithMock class is renamed to 'TestNeutronv2'.
Comments about replacing mox are removed.

This patch completes replacing mox with mock in the file.

Change-Id: I57040ea4457e53ad97d536591fd31808a5a6c227
Implements: blueprint mox-removal

commit_message:
Remove mox in unit/network/test_neutronv2.py (22)

Replace mox with mock in the following methods
in the TestNeutronv2 class
in nova/tests/unit/network/test_neutronv2.py
and moves the methods to the TestNeutronv2WithMock class.

* test_get_physnet_tunneled_info_multi_segment
* test_get_physnet_tunneled_info_vlan_with_multi_segment_ext
* test_get_physnet_tunneled_info_multi_segment_no_physnet
* test_get_physnet_tunneled_info_tunneled
* test_get_phynet_tunneled_info_non_tunneled
* _test_get_port_vnic_info
* test_get_port_vnic_info_1
* test_get_port_vnic_info_2
* test_get_port_vnic_info_3
* test_get_port_vnic_info_requested_resources

Then the TestNeutronv2 class is removed and
the TestNeutronv2WithMock class is renamed to 'TestNeutronv2'.
Comments about replacing mox are removed.

This patch completes replacing mox with mock in the file.

Change-Id: I57040ea4457e53ad97d536591fd31808a5a6c227
Implements: blueprint mox-removal-ussuri

commit_message:
Create allocated floating IPs for active reservations

We allow users to increase the amount of reserved floating IPs even for
active reservations. We need to ask Neutron to create them if the
reservation has started and on_start() was already executed.

Change-Id: I5d35460c82b9a06327445e2ca3bda6075e5b2619

commit_message:
Place readmet.txt for libvirt log

... so that operators can easily find the log files placed under
/var/log/containers.

Change-Id: I4a987307481cda09c5a837edb725d005ad11bf42

commit_message:
Remove mox in unit/network/test_neutronv2.py (13)

Replace mox with mock in the following methods
in the TestNeutronv2 class
in nova/tests/unit/network/test_neutronv2.py.
Then moves the methods to the TestNeutronv2WithMock class.

* test_validate_networks_with_ports_and_networks
* test_validate_networks_one_port_and_no_networks
* test_validate_networks_some_quota
* test_validate_networks_unlimited_quota
* test_validate_networks_no_quota_but_ports_supplied

Change-Id: If3d051c3a7ba18b36582862f0e141bf8b9e8b714
Implements: blueprint mox-removal-ussuri

commit_message:
Implement separate db per tenancy

At present, all time series are accumulated in the same database in
InfluxDB. This makes queries slow for tenants that have less data. This
patch enables the option to use separate database per tenancy.

This task implements the changes on monasca-persister which handles
write requests to InfluxDB database.

Change-Id: I7de6e0faf069b889d3953583b29a876c3d82c62c
Story: 2006331
Task: 36072

commit_message:
Fix empty sections in pdf document

The following sections were empty in the pdf document.

  3. Installation Guide
  4. Configuration Reference
  5. CLI Reference
  6. API Reference

This was because it is already referred in the second section.

  2. Admin Guide

This patch fixes the empty sections by moving the admin guide after
those sections.

Change-Id: I96d8b2fa9475c097e9eda6ecfc7ebb5a9f471567
Story: 2006073
Task: 34795

commit_message:
Release pymod2pkg 0.22.0

This fixes a mapping for PyOpenSSL on RDO and adds a
neutron-dynamic-routing translation for RDO and SUSE.

Change-Id: I77fc53a3759018667fb3f65476dcde6e130ef0e9

subject: Remove mox in unit/network/test_neutronv2.py (21)

commit_message:
Remove mox in unit/network/test_neutronv2.py (21)

Replace mox with mock in the following methods
in the TestNeutronv2 class
in nova/tests/unit/network/test_neutronv2.py.
Then moves the methods to the TestNeutronv2WithMock class.

* test_build_network_info_model_empty
* test_get_subnets_from_port
* test_get_subnets_from_port_enabled_dhcp
* test_get_subnets_from_port_enabled_dhcp_no_dhcp_ports
* test_get_all_empty_list_networks

Change-Id: Ib2774793381a45d8247eeec59a76d4fec586188e
Implements: blueprint mox-removal-ussuri

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-20 02:15:00.000000000', 'message': "Remove mox in unit/network/test_neutronv2.py (19)

Replace mox with mock in the following methods
in the TestNeutronv2 class
in nova/tests/unit/network/test_neutronv2.py.
Then moves the methods to the TestNeutronv2WithMock class.

* test_nw_info_build_no_match
* test_nw_info_build_network_vhostuser
* test_nw_info_build_network_vhostuser_fp
* _test_nw_info_build_custom_bridge
* test_nw_info_build_custom_ovs_bridge
* test_nw_info_build_custom_ovs_bridge_vhostuser
* test_nw_info_build_custom_lb_bridge

In the 'nova.network.neutronv2.API._nw_info_build_network' method,
the 'nova.network.neutronv2.get_client' method is not called.
So related code is removed in each test method.

Change-Id: I04ce1a829b01896d9ee69588bba06cee9aac1ddf
Implements: blueprint mox-removal
"}, {'created': '2018-06-26 06:16:09.000000000', 'message': "Remove mox in unit/network/test_neutronv2.py (19)

Replace mox with mock in the following methods
in the TestNeutronv2 class
in nova/tests/unit/network/test_neutronv2.py.
Then moves the methods to the TestNeutronv2WithMock class.

* test_nw_info_build_no_match
* test_nw_info_build_network_vhostuser
* test_nw_info_build_network_vhostuser_fp
* _test_nw_info_build_custom_bridge
* test_nw_info_build_custom_ovs_bridge
* test_nw_info_build_custom_ovs_bridge_vhostuser
* test_nw_info_build_custom_lb_bridge

In the 'nova.network.neutronv2.API._nw_info_build_network' method,
the 'nova.network.neutronv2.get_client' method is not called.
So related code is removed in each test method.

Change-Id: I04ce1a829b01896d9ee69588bba06cee9aac1ddf
Implements: blueprint mox-removal
"}, {'created': '2018-06-27 23:52:59.000000000', 'message': "Remove mox in unit/network/test_neutronv2.py (19)

Replace mox with mock in the following methods
in the TestNeutronv2 class
in nova/tests/unit/network/test_neutronv2.py.
Then moves the methods to the TestNeutronv2WithMock class.

* test_nw_info_build_no_match
* test_nw_info_build_network_vhostuser
* test_nw_info_build_network_vhostuser_fp
* _test_nw_info_build_custom_bridge
* test_nw_info_build_custom_ovs_bridge
* test_nw_info_build_custom_ovs_bridge_vhostuser
* test_nw_info_build_custom_lb_bridge

the 'nova.network.neutronv2.get_client' method is not called.
So related code is removed in each test method.

commit_message:
Remove mox in unit/network/test_neutronv2.py (19)

Replace mox with mock in the following methods
in the TestNeutronv2 class
in nova/tests/unit/network/test_neutronv2.py.
Then moves the methods to the TestNeutronv2WithMock class.

* test_nw_info_build_no_match
* test_nw_info_build_network_vhostuser
* test_nw_info_build_network_vhostuser_fp
* _test_nw_info_build_custom_bridge
* test_nw_info_build_custom_ovs_bridge
* test_nw_info_build_custom_ovs_bridge_vhostuser
* test_nw_info_build_custom_lb_bridge

In the 'nova.network.neutronv2.API._nw_info_build_network' method,
the 'nova.network.neutronv2.get_client' method is not called.
So related code is removed in each test method.

Change-Id: I04ce1a829b01896d9ee69588bba06cee9aac1ddf
Implements: blueprint mox-removal-ussuri

* test_nw_info_build_network_other

commit_message:
Remove mox in unit/network/test_neutronv2.py (18)

Replace mox with mock in the following methods
in the TestNeutronv2 class
in nova/tests/unit/network/test_neutronv2.py.
Then moves the methods to the TestNeutronv2WithMock class.

* test_list_floating_ips_without_l3_support
* test_nw_info_get_ips
* test_nw_info_get_subnets
* _test_nw_info_build_network
* test_nw_info_build_network_ovs
* test_nw_info_build_network_dvs
* test_nw_info_build_network_bridge
* test_nw_info_build_network_tap
* test_nw_info_build_network_other

Change-Id: Ia02448837a6b8b6e7a91cf142cee1e4e7e22d115
Implements: blueprint mox-removal-ussuri

commit_message:
Remove mox in unit/network/test_neutronv2.py (17)

Replace mox with mock in the following methods
in the TestNeutronv2 class
in nova/tests/unit/network/test_neutronv2.py.
Then moves the methods to the TestNeutronv2WithMock class.

* test_disassociate_and_release_floating_ip_with_instance
* test_associate_floating_ip
* test_reassociate_floating_ip
* test_associate_floating_ip_not_found_fixed_ip
* test_disassociate_floating_ip
* test_add_fixed_ip_to_instance
* test_remove_fixed_ip_from_instance

The following method is removed because mocking and assertions
are moved to each test methods.

* _setup_mock_for_refresh_cache

Change-Id: I0072978a4e1eb08d901a8923079bc9a4c6290c8c
Implements: blueprint mox-removal-ussuri

Remove mox in unit/network/test_neutronv2.py (16)

Replace mox with mock in the following methods
in the TestNeutronv2 class
in nova/tests/unit/network/test_neutronv2.py.
Then moves the methods to the TestNeutronv2WithMock class.

* test_disassociate_and_release_floating_ip

[{'created': '2018-06-18 05:30:28.000000000', 'message': 'Remove mox in unit/network/test_neutronv2.py (15)

in the TestNeutronv2 class
in nova/tests/unit/network/test_neutronv2.py.
Then moves the methods to the TestNeutronv2WithMock class.

* _test_get_floating_ip
* test_get_floating_ip_unassociated
* test_get_floating_ip_associated
* test_get_floating_ip_by_address
* test_get_floating_ip_by_address_associated
* test_get_floating_ip_by_address_not_found
* test_get_floating_ip_by_id_not_found
* test_get_floating_ip_raises_non404
* test_get_floating_ip_by_address_multiple_found
* test_get_floating_ips_by_project

The following methods are just moved
from the TestNeutronv2 class to the TestNeutronv2WithMock class.

* _get_expected_fip_model
* _compare

Change-Id: Iedbeb4a8bce480e12e119b112bf918769c8d0381

commit_message:
Remove mox in unit/network/test_neutronv2.py (15)

Replace mox with mock in the following methods
in the TestNeutronv2 class
in nova/tests/unit/network/test_neutronv2.py.
Then moves the methods to the TestNeutronv2WithMock class.

* _test_get_floating_ip
* test_get_floating_ip_unassociated

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-18 04:38:13.000000000', 'message': "Remove mox in unit/network/test_neutronv2.py (14)

Replace mox with mock in the following methods
in the TestNeutronv2 class
in nova/tests/unit/network/test_neutronv2.py.
Then moves the methods to the TestNeutronv2WithMock class.

* _mock_list_ports
* test_get_fixed_ip_by_address_fails_for_no_ports
* test_get_fixed_ip_by_address_succeeds_for_1_port
* test_get_fixed_ip_by_address_fails_for_more_than_1_port
* _get_available_networks

commit_message:
Remove mox in unit/network/test_neutronv2.py (14)

Replace mox with mock in the following methods
in the TestNeutronv2 class
in nova/tests/unit/network/test_neutronv2.py.
Then moves the methods to the TestNeutronv2WithMock class.

* _mock_list_ports
* test_get_fixed_ip_by_address_fails_for_no_ports
* test_get_fixed_ip_by_address_succeeds_for_1_port
* test_get_fixed_ip_by_address_fails_for_more_than_1_port
* _get_available_networks
* test_get_available_networks_all_private
* test_get_available_networks_all_public
* test_get_available_networks_private_and_public
* test_get_available_networks_with_network_ids
* test_get_available_networks_with_custom_policy
* test_get_floating_ip_pools

The _mock_list_ports method is renamed to
'_test_get_fixed_ip_by_address_with_exception'.
The _get_available_networks method is renamed to
'_test_get_available_networks'.

Change-Id: I6be994eda6b62c5d12c3763efdcb563ce7eb5ca3
Implements: blueprint mox-removal-ussuri

subject: Add xindy to pdf-docs prereqs
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 6547, 'name': 'Andreas Jaeger', 'email': 'jaegerandi@gmail.com', 'username': 'jaegerandi'}, {'_account_id': 7118, 'name': 'Ian Wienand', 'email': 'iwienand@redhat.com', 'username': 'iwienand'}, {'_account_id': 10607, 'name': 'Alexandra Settle', 'email': 'a.settle@outlook.com', 'username': 'asettle'}, {'_account_id': 13252, 'name': 'Dr. Jens Harbott', 'display_name': 'Dr. Jens Harbott (frickler)', 'email': 'frickler@offenerstapel.de', 'username': 'jrosenboom'}, {'_account_id': 15334, 'name': 'Stephen Finucane', 'display_name': 'stephenfin', 'email': 'stephenfin@redhat.com', 'username': 'sfinucan'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2019-09-26 14:50:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10607, 'date': '2019-09-26 15:03:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2019-09-27 01:09:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2019-09-27 07:36:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

This isn't packaged on Fedora which means anyone using that will not be able to build PDF docs. Not sure if that's a reason not to package it, though the reason it's not packaged on Fedora in the first place might be [1]

[1] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1622164"}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2019-09-27 08:14:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Ah, I only saw the other bug that is mentioned in most configs and that is resolved, so I assumed that the issue had been fixed for Fedora.

Still two arguments in favor:

1) As long as we only build the pdfs in gate on Bionic, we can never be sure that there aren't any other possible regressions on different platforms.

2) Just because we add the pkg here doesn't mean that projects actually have to use it. So if they still want to be nice to Fedora users, nobody is stopping them."}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2019-09-27 10:24:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Ah, I only saw the other bug that is mentioned in most configs and
 > that is resolved, so I assumed that the issue had been fixed for
 > Fedora.
 > 
 > Still two arguments in favor:
 > 
 > 1) As long as we only build the pdfs in gate on Bionic, we can
 > never be sure that there aren't any other possible regressions on
 > different platforms.
 > 
 > 2) Just because we add the pkg here doesn't mean that projects
 > actually have to use it. So if they still want to be nice to Fedora
 > users, nobody is stopping them.

Fair point. Having to set 'use_xindy = False' for each doc build is annoying and I can (and will) still set it on the projects I care about. With that said, it's still more work for me, at least :) As such, I'm not +1 but I will abstain"}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2019-09-27 10:28:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Another data point - I don't see it packaged for CentOS 7 [1] or 8 [2] either.

[1] http://mirror.centos.org/centos/7/os/x86_64/Packages/
[2] http://mirror.centos.org/centos/8/AppStream/x86_64/os/Packages/"}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2019-09-27 12:29:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Alternative: Disable xindy via the theme - once that is merged, we can revert... For now, let's merge to make it easier for projects."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-26 14:50:13.000000000', 'message': "Add xindy to pdf-docs prereqs

xindy[0] is an index processor used by LaTeX. Instead of disabling it in
all projects, let's add it to prereqs and see how it goes. See also [1].

[0] https://ctan.org/pkg/xindy?lang=en
[1] https://review.opendev.org/684451

Change-Id: Iaef8a36dc24b0aacb11454d112044c80613d5263
"}]
commit_message:
Add xindy to pdf-docs prereqs

xindy[0] is an index processor used by LaTeX. Instead of disabling it in
all projects, let's add it to prereqs and see how it goes. See also [1].

[0] https://ctan.org/pkg/xindy?lang=en
[1] https://review.opendev.org/684451

Change-Id: Iaef8a36dc24b0aacb11454d112044c80613d5263

commit_message:
Revert "Lock privileged.agent.linux.ip_lib functions"

This reverts commit 284afcf24f2dfd3af20a803ada79c69205249f25.

Pyroute2 bug [1] is solved and merged. We should not require anymore
the synchronization between the ip_lib functions.

[1] https://github.com/svinota/pyroute2/issues/578

Change-Id: Ia1553451b23cdd1f04b29c8b32c4ae8399801765

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-26 12:20:31.000000000', 'message': 'Add support to set option:mtu in inspector dnsmasq

It should be possible to configure the DHCP server to
provide the mtu option for inspection subnets.

This uses the dhcp-option-force so that the option is
provided also when the client does not ask for it.
According to dnsmasq manual page this is sometimes
required when sending options to PXELINUX.

Closes-Bug: #1845487
Change-Id: Ic95dbf1867fb5397f1b6d8f23466910a97051cb6
'}]
commit_message:
Add support to set option:mtu in inspector dnsmasq

It should be possible to configure the DHCP server to
provide the mtu option for inspection subnets.

This uses the dhcp-option-force so that the option is
provided also when the client does not ask for it.
According to dnsmasq manual page this is sometimes
required when sending options to PXELINUX.

Closes-Bug: #1845487
Change-Id: Ic95dbf1867fb5397f1b6d8f23466910a97051cb6

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/train branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/train

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/train branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I5df32acc04b8b54c4f403d604ad6ca736f342690

commit_message:
Correct deprecated usage of ironicclient (broken with 3.0.0)

The ironicclient.v1.client.Client started requiring passing a Session
with 3.0.0. Use the high-level interface ironicclient.client.get_client
instead since it can create a Session for us.

Change-Id: I913f5b127be59cb86df2102724ba1f3cea10f384
Closes-Bug: #1845189

Remove pyOpenSSL mapping for RDO

We can now use python2-pyOpenSSL and python3-pyOpenSSL as package
names.

commit_message:
Update master for stable/train

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/train.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/train.

Sem-Ver: feature

commit_message:
Update lib release instructions for freeze

This updates the instructions for client and non-client lib freeze to
make sure all changes are captured in a final release. Also adds a
helper tool to separate out the two types of libs since they have
different deadlines.

Change-Id: I29ea73bcc5a9649d7d9c502ebc0a05c840e41484
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Support time range to query dimension names/values

At present, dimensions are not scoped by time window, which makes
dimension related queries to large databases timeout because it searches
all of time instead of a time window specified on the grafana app.

This commit implements the client side changes to address issue by
scoping the search to time range specified on the app. It also bumps up
the plugin version to 1.3.0 since it is a minor backward compatible API
change.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/670318
Change-Id: I13614595707697552119926273f06967b8d49b1d
Story: 2006204
Task: 35789

 > Could you present the improvement in the IRC team meeting?"}, {'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2019-07-12 14:59:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Also happy to present this in the meeting next wednesday.'}, {'account_id': 17669, 'date': '2019-07-12 15:44:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(2 comments)

The actual change looks good to me, nice job.'}, {'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2019-07-15 10:12:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2019-07-15 10:41:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2019-07-15 11:11:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 17669, 'date': '2019-07-16 16:58:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Workflow-1

Bharat identified some issues with the InfluxDB query generated from this.'}, {'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2019-07-25 11:28:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10: Patch Set 9 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 29970, 'date': '2019-07-27 02:12:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Code-Review+1

it is a very useful feature.we use cassandra as database backend for many months.but api always throw timeout error.i think this feature can reduce timeout errors.at present,we use cassandra and influxdb currently ,and hava two types of persisters.cassandra performance is much lower than influxdb no mater query operation or write operation.'}, {'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2019-07-29 10:18:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2019-07-29 11:19:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 29970, 'date': '2019-07-30 01:10:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

it is a useful feature in grafana console.but i hava a quesiton.as a user,we hava thousands of agent collectiong service metrics in our cloud platform.we use api query deimension.how did we set starttime and endtime.so many metrics we do not know when the metrics with specific dimension were collected.or we know when metrics with specific dimensions were collected,but metrics were collected then can queried by api through some time.in that situation,how did we set startTime and endTime ？'}, {'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2019-09-04 09:23:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

So we have a better understanding of the strange behaviour now. Looks like the SHOW TAG KEY/VALUE queries in InfluxDB that are scoped within a time range, the results are accurate to shard duration. E.g. if the retention policy is unbounded, the default shard duration is 1 week. On the other hand, when the retention policy is 2 week, the shard duration appears to be 1 day... which explains why we Influxdb is returning results outside of the time window. My feeling is that this is fine for things like metric name lookup queries which we use to narrow down search results to relevant shards as at present, the query is unbounded and looks in the entire database which results in long running queries.'}, {'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2019-09-05 11:08:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

Here's the data:

Influx DB query time

Entire database

time docker exec -it influxdb influx -host 192.168.7.1 -database monasca_5638e8577bc84379baba4bfb66177086 -execute "SHOW TAG VALUES WITH KEY=hostname"

real    0m2.652s
user    0m0.011s
sys     0m0.015s

time docker exec -it influxdb influx -host 192.168.7.1 -database monasca_5638e8577bc84379baba4bfb66177086 -execute 'SELECT DISTINCT("hostname") from (SELECT * FROM /.*/ GROUP BY *)'

ERR: no data received
no data received

Time bound

time docker exec -it influxdb influx -host 192.168.7.1 -database monasca_5638e8577bc84379baba4bfb66177086 -execute "SHOW TAG VALUES WITH KEY=hostname WHERE time >= 1564081121495ms AND time < 1564084721497ms"

real    0m0.927s
user    0m0.014s
sys     0m0.009s

time docker exec -it influxdb influx -host 192.168.7.1 -database monasca_5638e8577bc84379baba4bfb66177086 -execute 'SELECT DISTINCT("hostname") from (SELECT * FROM /.*/ WHERE time >= 1564081121495ms AND time < 1564084721497ms GROUP BY *)'

real    0m18.354s
user    0m0.019s
sys     0m0.005s'}, {'account_id': 17669, 'date': '2019-09-05 12:39:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11:

From that data point it doesn't look like the SELECT approach performs very well.

It still scares me that you could specify a range of a few minutes, and get back data from the last week, or maybe the last hour, or whatever your shard duration is. On the other hand it is optional, and allows dynamic hostname population in Grafana dashboards to work efficiently in large databases where the existing query would be too slow. It would be interesting to hear what other people think. Rather than making this the default for the Grafana datasource, it could be off by default, but I still worry about it confusing people."}, {'account_id': 16222, 'date': '2019-09-26 14:31:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

Change appears useful to me. Could you please add a release note?'}, {'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2019-09-26 15:11:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 16222, 'date': '2019-09-27 09:43:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 29970, 'date': '2019-09-27 10:42:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Code-Review+1'}]

commit_message:
Support time range to query dimension names/values

At present, dimensions are not scoped by time window, which makes
dimension related queries to large databases timeout because it searches
all of time instead of a time window specified on the grafana app.

This commit implements the server side changes required to scope the
search query by the time window specified on the app.

Change-Id: Ia760c6789ac0063b8a25e52c9e0c3cc3b790ad2d
Story: 2005204
Task: 35790

commit_message:
Remove explicit call to py2

Python 2 is sunsetting in Jan 2020. We should not be finding python 2
explicitly. This patch removes those calls.

Change-Id: Ie6c9ad77097e662393c5fdd26490ebef25bdc3de
Signed-off-by: Tin Lam <tin@irrational.io>

commit_message:
Update master for stable/train

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/train.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/train.

Change-Id: I79821c0f38575efaae0c3aef0917628473eca013
Sem-Ver: feature

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-16 13:27:59.000000000', 'message': "[train][goal] Define new blazar-devstack-dsvm-ipv6-only job

As part of Train community goal 'Support IPv6-Only Deployments and Testing'[1],
we need to define the integration job which deploy services
on IPv6 and perform testing to make sure service listen and communicate
over IPv6 properly.

Blazar has legacy zuul jobs only so base zuulv3 IPv6 job 'devstack-ipv6' and
'devstack-tempest-ipv6' cannot be used and we have to copy the whole
run.yaml to set the IPv6 setting and run the IPv6 verification
script via post_test_hook.

This commit adds the new job 'blazar-devstack-dsvm-ipv6-only'
run on gate and set the required IPv6 setting'.

Story: #2005477
Task: #35882

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/ipv6-support-and-testing.html

Change-Id: I9a598f591d3fbb40c90be5bd12913b851aff2c9f

"}, {'created': '2019-09-19 12:36:18.000000000', 'message': "[train][goal] Define new blazar-devstack-dsvm-ipv6-only job

As part of Train community goal 'Support IPv6-Only Deployments and
Testing' [1], we need to define the integration job which deploy
services on IPv6 and perform testing to make sure service listen and
communicate over IPv6 properly.

Blazar has legacy zuul jobs only so base zuulv3 IPv6 job 'devstack-ipv6'
and 'devstack-tempest-ipv6' cannot be used and we have to copy the whole
run.yaml to set the IPv6 setting and run the IPv6 verification script
via post_test_hook.

This commit adds the new job 'blazar-devstack-dsvm-ipv6-only' run on
gate and set the required IPv6 setting'.

It also updates Blazar code so that [DEFAULT]/os_auth_host is bracketed
when used to build URLs, as required for IPv6 addresses.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/ipv6-support-and-testing.html

Change-Id: I9a598f591d3fbb40c90be5bd12913b851aff2c9f
Co-Authored-By: Pierre Riteau <pierre@stackhpc.com>
Story: #2005477
Task: #35882
"}, {'created': '2019-09-20 01:26:01.000000000', 'message': "[train][goal] Define new blazar-devstack-dsvm-ipv6-only job

As part of Train community goal 'Support IPv6-Only Deployments and
Testing' [1], we need to define the integration job which deploy
services on IPv6 and perform testing to make sure service listen and
communicate over IPv6 properly.

Blazar has legacy zuul jobs only so base zuulv3 IPv6 job 'devstack-ipv6'
and 'devstack-tempest-ipv6' cannot be used and we have to copy the whole
run.yaml to set the IPv6 setting and run the IPv6 verification script
via post_test_hook.

This commit adds the new job 'blazar-devstack-dsvm-ipv6-only' run on
gate and set the required IPv6 setting'.

It also updates Blazar code so that [DEFAULT]/os_auth_host is bracketed
when used to build URLs, as required for IPv6 addresses.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/ipv6-support-and-testing.html

commit_message:
[train][goal] Define new blazar-devstack-dsvm-ipv6-only job

As part of Train community goal 'Support IPv6-Only Deployments and
Testing' [1], we need to define the integration job which deploy
services on IPv6 and perform testing to make sure service listen and
communicate over IPv6 properly.

Blazar has legacy zuul jobs only so base zuulv3 IPv6 job 'devstack-ipv6'
and 'devstack-tempest-ipv6' cannot be used and we have to copy the whole
run.yaml to set the IPv6 setting and run the IPv6 verification script
via post_test_hook.

This commit adds the new job 'blazar-devstack-dsvm-ipv6-only' run on
gate and set the required IPv6 setting'.

It also updates Blazar code so that [DEFAULT]/os_auth_host is bracketed
when used to build URLs, as required for IPv6 addresses.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/ipv6-support-and-testing.html

Change-Id: I9a598f591d3fbb40c90be5bd12913b851aff2c9f
Co-Authored-By: Pierre Riteau <pierre@stackhpc.com>
Story: #2005477
Task: #35882

commit_message:
Fix for getting port groups while using OVS up to 2.9

Functions get_port_group() and get_port_groups() were failing
with KeyError while getting to access non-existent Port_Group
table with OVS 2.9.

This patch adds additional check if Port Group is supported in the
env where the code runs.

Change-Id: If3ce6ab1d1318a6d5142989b3bf45ecce97762e3
Closes-Bug: #1844491
(cherry picked from commit 501d48b181b1d93ac634021860aff708ff9d940e)

commit_message:
Revert "Set binding profile directly from OVNTrunkDriver"

During recent days we many observed failures of
neutron_tempest_plugin.scenario.test_trunk.TrunkTest.test_trunk_subport_lifecycle test.
It started to fail on a different asserts.
Lets revert this patch, as it is a regression, and work further on this issue.

This reverts commit 41f6d622abc65ca4c10b08f8c022915df2809255.

Related-Bug: #1834637
Related-Bug: #1845479

Change-Id: I244b937e916474703abf0a0c802e13bcd5a54918

commit_message:
Use ThreadGroup.add_timer() API correctly

In practice we never pass any arguments to the callback function, but if
we did we'd be doing it wrong. Multiple projects appear to have copied
this code from us (directly or indirectly). Fix it before we lead anyone
else astray.

Change-Id: If9cddc470158f32587b2aac19e92d1e01b48bc50

[{'created': '2019-09-26 12:29:03.000000000', 'message': 'Fixes race cond. during updates of neutron resources

When macvlan driver updates neutron resources during pods creation
in short period of time, only last address pair remains in Neutron.
We need to utilize revision_number feature of neutron api, to
detect such race condition and attempt to resend updated api request
in such case.

Co-Authored-By: Michał Dulko <mdulko@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: 1845307
Change-Id: I01c544cc284f4e7bc339ac4f422e90a0c6cb31fa
(cherry picked from commit 3208b192ad835f55af2a40884af960b8e86ed2d7)
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes race cond. during updates of neutron resources

When macvlan driver updates neutron resources during pods creation
in short period of time, only last address pair remains in Neutron.
We need to utilize revision_number feature of neutron api, to
detect such race condition and attempt to resend updated api request
in such case.

Co-Authored-By: Michał Dulko <mdulko@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: 1845307
Change-Id: I01c544cc284f4e7bc339ac4f422e90a0c6cb31fa
(cherry picked from commit 3208b192ad835f55af2a40884af960b8e86ed2d7)

commit_message:
Ensure availability_zone set globally for agents

Inline with the neutron-gateway charm, move availability_zone
configuration to the neutron.conf configuration file to ensure
that its set consistently for all neutron agents that may be
running on the unit.

Change-Id: If9438302f8f889a1cbaf93f8a460e190e551241b
Closes-Bug: 1829537

[{'created': '2019-05-31 14:13:04.000000000', 'message': 'Do not re-clone heat in devstack plugin

devstack already clones the source from the repo/ref provided to
enable_plugin function.
Having to re-clone heat effectively requires to also set HEAT_BRANCH
separately which is unnecessary repetition and make it less obvious
how to deploy Devstack+Heat from stable branches locally w/o Zuul Cloner
with RECLONE=true.

Change-Id: I91b5048efa4606e86094e0a458e320216f66ce3e
'}]
commit_message:
Do not re-clone heat in devstack plugin

devstack already clones the source from the repo/ref provided to
enable_plugin function.
Having to re-clone heat effectively requires to also set HEAT_BRANCH
separately which is unnecessary repetition and make it less obvious
how to deploy Devstack+Heat from stable branches locally w/o Zuul Cloner
with RECLONE=true.

Change-Id: I91b5048efa4606e86094e0a458e320216f66ce3e

commit_message:
Build pdf doc

One of community goals is that each project should produce a single PDF
file. The pdf should be in the output of the openstack-tox-docs job.

TeX packages are required to build PDF locally, the following are
recommended:

* inkscape
* texlive-latex-base
* texlive-latex-extra
* texlive-fonts-recommended

More about the goal:

* https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/pdf-doc-generation.html
* https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/train-pdf-support-goal
* https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/pdf-goal-train-common-problems

Change-Id: If9850d8275e8c4f46b393b2cdd91c8963b9844a1
Story: 2006073
Task: 34795

commit_message:
Switch knownhost caching on by default

This change "flips the switch" by changing the default for caching
knownhosts to true.  This means that during deployment host lookups are
only performed once for each related unit.  This was experimental for
the previous charm release.

Release note is change-id: Ib3d17b4057dd7f671f123b1da7df21c9f3d7e182

Change-Id: I644df508563f93b661af6bfd5fb668f0e31d5e4d

Warning filter was enabled while fixing Launchpad bug #1516020 and later
when deprecation unused exceptions were removed, warning filter wasn't
removed due to which when glance_store is used by other projects, it
emits DeprecationWarning messages continuously.

This patch removes the unwanted warning filter.

Change-Id: Ibf227d509e567ccbcf77676277300511de2ad14d
Closes-Bug: #1844462
(cherry picked from commit 59f55c69074b9fcbbefbf060212968b42f8fa2fe)

commit_message:
Remove warning filter

Warning filter was enabled while fixing Launchpad bug #1516020 and later
when deprecation unused exceptions were removed, warning filter wasn't
removed due to which when glance_store is used by other projects, it
emits DeprecationWarning messages continuously.

This patch removes the unwanted warning filter.

Change-Id: Ibf227d509e567ccbcf77676277300511de2ad14d
Closes-Bug: #1844462
(cherry picked from commit 59f55c69074b9fcbbefbf060212968b42f8fa2fe)

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/train branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I798a97645ad3b3e593b695a92373b9d1a882891e
'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/train

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/train branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I798a97645ad3b3e593b695a92373b9d1a882891e

commit_message:
Update master for stable/train

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/train.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/train.

Change-Id: I730613773423c670cdca4b7ca0798e855699e840
Sem-Ver: feature

[{'created': '2019-02-06 18:31:39.000000000', 'message': 'docs: Update the PCI passthrough guides

This is mostly an exercise in refactoring with some nice usability
improvements.

- Remove use of bullet points in favour of more descriptive steps
- Cross-reference various configuration options
- Emphasise that ``[pci] alias`` must be set on both controller and
  compute node
- Style nits, such as fixing the header style

Change-Id: I2ac7df7d235f0af25f5a99bc8f6abddbae2cb3af
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
docs: Rework the PCI passthrough guides

Rewrite the document, making the following changes:

- Remove use of bullet points in favour of more descriptive steps
- Cross-reference various configuration options
- Emphasise that ``[pci] alias`` must be set on both controller and
  compute node
- Style nits, such as fixing the header style

Change-Id: I2ac7df7d235f0af25f5a99bc8f6abddbae2cb3af
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
docs: Correct 'nova-manage db sync' documentation

In change I3fd9fe0317bcd1a59c366e60154b095e8df92327, we deprecated the
'--version' option in favour of a 'VERSION' positional. This was later
removed in change I7795e308497de66329f288b43ecfbf978d67ad75. Update the
docs to reflect this. 'nova-manage api_db sync' were already corrected
in change Ibc49f93b8bd51d9a050acde5ef3dc8aad91321ca and does not need
the same fix, though a minor tweak is included.

Change-Id: I2c0fb04fbc3f6d2074596894782ed3143b0c2338
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1840807

Experimental wsgi support

but should be functional.

commit_message:
Raise correct exception when endpoint false config

EndpointNotFound will be made when the keystone v3 API is not
found in the service catalog, or if the v2.0 endpoint was
registered as the root endpoint. We treat this the same as 404
previously but it's not correct as it's telling user something
is missing, but in reality it's an internal error

There are some concern about whether we should return 500 error,
we should not lie about the result, if it's an internal error,
we should report it instead fake a success and delay the error
occurance as it will eventually be there.

Change-Id: I25fced32abcb797081ee3dfe47fec2b1faf38a2e
Related-Bug: 1771517

commit_message:
policy.d override support for reactive OpenStack charms

This patchset provides support for policy.d overrides in
charms.openstack based charms.  It is essentially an adapter for the
charm-helpers policyd module which does the heavy lifting for all of the
policy.d overrides.

This change depends on the charm-helpers change:
https://github.com/juju/charm-helpers/pull/368

Change-Id: I495ce9f5be1815c78a2295d33bab4b9a774d805c

[{'created': '2019-09-26 14:30:57.000000000', 'message': "Recover the functional test

There are two issues currently:
* The ironic-inspector version we're pinning to is not compatible
  with ironicclient 3.0.0+
* The way we invoke OSC is not compatible with OSC 4.0.0+

The latter is trivial to fix by switching to --os-auth-type=none.

Updating ironic-inspector pulls in problems with importing
ironic_inspector.common.swift. Fortunately, ironic-inspector's
own functional tests have switching to the database backend for
introspection data, so just follow the pack.

Finally, the hacking requirement is synchronized with inspector.

Change-Id: Iaa5161c693f1b1a9d6765d3d7d8ed82ea154abb9
"}]
commit_message:
Recover the functional test

There are two issues currently:
* The ironic-inspector version we're pinning to is not compatible
  with ironicclient 3.0.0+
* The way we invoke OSC is not compatible with OSC 4.0.0+

The latter is trivial to fix by switching to --os-auth-type=none.

Updating ironic-inspector pulls in problems with importing
ironic_inspector.common.swift. Fortunately, ironic-inspector's
own functional tests have switching to the database backend for
introspection data, so just follow the pack.

Finally, the hacking requirement is synchronized with inspector.

Change-Id: Iaa5161c693f1b1a9d6765d3d7d8ed82ea154abb9

commit_message:
Update Neutron reference docs

Add Neutron reference docs, especially a note around
using OVS native firewall driver on recent (4.3+) kernels [1].

[1]: https://docs.openstack.org/neutron/latest/admin/config-ovsfwdriver.html

Change-Id: I6994e364c116234b46f5d5e9f0a4666b83f86375
Closes-Bug: #1653987

commit_message:
Update master for stable/train

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/train.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/train.

Change-Id: I1b2597b660c21fb7cde6828a2bba631e8cc29794
Sem-Ver: feature

subject: Auto release request for cyborg
messages:
[{'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2019-09-23 18:09:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 21672, 'date': '2019-09-23 18:45:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

We have few more changes as WIP. I beleieve the last day is Thursday midnight. is it midnight UTC?'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2019-09-24 08:29:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

It's end of day Thursday... meaning that we approve the patch on Friday UTC morning unless a specific exception is granted."}, {'account_id': 21672, 'date': '2019-09-25 19:57:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

We have following issues affecting RC:
* https://review.opendev.org/682565: affects interaction with other services
* https://review.opendev.org/673957: affects security
* https://review.opendev.org/683733: affects security
* https://review.opendev.org/684193: affects backwards compatibility'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-09-26 12:25:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Any updates on the progress of those Sundar? Is this going to meet today's deadline, or should we expect to have to wait on this?"}, {'account_id': 21672, 'date': '2019-09-26 14:50:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Sean, we made lots of progress:
https://review.opendev.org/682565: affects interaction with other services --> close, but not done yet
https://review.opendev.org/673957: affects security --> merged
https://review.opendev.org/683733: affects security --> merged
https://review.opendev.org/684193: affects backwards compatibility --> merged

We also made progress on:
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/681005/ -- this fixes a deviation from the approved specs, so we are doing our best to get this in.

Unfortunately, we haven't got many eyeballs on documentation in general:
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/677715/ --> Add driver support matrix
I am trying to close on that. Nearly all of our developers are in APAC region, so I'll have to wait till evening Pacific time to get a handle on that.

Does it look like Cyborg is the only laggard? Do others need more time too?"}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-09-26 15:31:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

There will probably be others. Just to help track what is going on, do you think this will be ready for today's deadline, or do you think this will take a few days yet?

Keep in mind, additional RCs can be done before the final deadline. But we also don't want to create the RC and branch of we know things are coming soon."}, {'account_id': 21672, 'date': '2019-09-26 16:36:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

IMO, the pending tasks will take a few days to a week, for us to do them properly.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-09-26 17:33:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> IMO, the pending tasks will take a few days to a week, for us to do
 > them properly.

Hmm, in that case, it may make sense to cut an RC now to let downstream folks pick things up and start testing, then plan on cutting an rc2 once the other fixes get merged. Assuming the current state is not completely broken.'}, {'account_id': 21672, 'date': '2019-09-26 17:59:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

Agreed. Please use the latest hash.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-09-26 18:19:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 21672, 'date': '2019-09-26 19:28:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-09-26 19:58:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 21672, 'date': '2019-09-27 01:07:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 21672, 'date': '2019-09-27 04:21:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 21672, 'date': '2019-09-27 04:42:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2019-09-27 08:41:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-06-01 09:10:51.000000000', 'message': 'Delete the instance files when revert resize

If instance use shared storage, revert resize need
delete the instance dir and files on destination host.

Change-Id: I868180fc4e87c4dafb1e54b7d31c8437f17e4122
Closes-Bug: #1694913
'}, {'created': '2017-06-07 11:00:45.000000000', 'message': 'Delete the instance files after revert a resize task

If instance use shared storage, revert a resize task need delete
the instance dir and files on destination host to ensure a smooth
live migration at next time.

Change-Id: I868180fc4e87c4dafb1e54b7d31c8437f17e4122
Closes-Bug: #1694913
'}, {'created': '2017-06-08 02:25:53.000000000', 'message': 'Delete the instance files after revert a resize task

commit_message:
Delete the instance files after revert a resize task

If instance uses shared storage, revert a resize task needs to delete
the instance dir and files on destination host to ensure a smooth
live migration at next time.

Change-Id: I868180fc4e87c4dafb1e54b7d31c8437f17e4122
Closes-Bug: #1694913

commit_message:
More package updates

- Mostly version bumps
- virtualbmc switched to python3 only. It was anyway only useful with
- python3 given that only on py3 all files were available.

commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/train

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/train branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I539ae9c746d7694cd988c820c33b64825c2ff07d

commit_message:
ng-8: APIs for nodegroup CRUD operations

This adds the changes needed in the API and conductor level to support
creating updating and deleting nodegroups.

Change-Id: I4ad60994ad6b4cb9cac18129557e1e87e61ae98c

'}, {'created': '2019-09-02 09:30:36.000000000', 'message': "Enable system upgrade and upgrade run per host.

Allow the execution of the overcloud upgrade steps by hosts
withing the Overcloud roles. After this patch is merged, the hosts
contained in the ovecloud roles (Controllers, Computes, Storage, etc...)
will be taken serially to apply the upgrade host by host.

For each of the hosts within these roles we'll execute the following steps:

1- Pre overcloud system upgrade workarounds (Workaround executed in the host
   via Ansible with --limit)
2a- Overcloud system upgrade prepare + overcloud system upgrade run (if
   system_upgrade_compact == false)
2b- Overcloud system upgrade (if system_upgrade_compact == true) [Default]
3- Overcloud system upgrade transfer (if role == Controller and host == first)
4- Post overcloud system upgrade workaronuds (Workaround executed in the host
   via Ansible with --limit)
5- Pre overcloud upgrade run workarounds (Workaround executed in the host
   via Ansible with --limit)
6- Overcloud upgrade run
7- Post overcloud upgrade run workarounds (Workaround executed in the host
   via Ansible with --limit)

These sets of steps will be executed for all the hosts belonging to the
Overcloud Ansible group.

Change-Id: Ia13f479d58979561fca1c274ac7dde5dc8c2343a

commit_message:
Enable system upgrade and upgrade run per host.

Allow the execution of the overcloud upgrade steps by hosts
withing the Overcloud roles. After this patch is merged, the hosts
contained in the ovecloud roles (Controllers, Computes, Storage, etc...)
will be taken serially to apply the upgrade host by host.

For each of the hosts within these roles we'll execute the following
steps:

1- Pre overcloud system upgrade workarounds (Workaround executed in the
   host via Ansible with --limit)
2a- Overcloud system upgrade prepare + overcloud system upgrade run (if
   system_upgrade_compact == false)
2b- Overcloud system upgrade (if system_upgrade_compact == true)[Default]
3- Overcloud system upgrade transfer (if role == Controller and
   host == first)
4- Post overcloud system upgrade workaronuds (Workaround executed in the
   host via Ansible with --limit)
5- Pre overcloud upgrade run workarounds (Workaround executed in the
   host via Ansible with --limit)
6- Overcloud upgrade run
7- Post overcloud upgrade run workarounds (Workaround executed in the
   host via Ansible with --limit)

These sets of steps will be executed for all the hosts belonging to the
Overcloud Ansible group.

Change-Id: Ia13f479d58979561fca1c274ac7dde5dc8c2343a

commit_message:
Add timestamps for logged image processing events

Mimics formatting, like if were using oslo_log configuration
file. That provides timestamps for better profiling of events
related to the image uploading etc.

Change-Id: Ia63e6b49a5d801c83d9c19ff8606ebbe0cd973d7
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Bootstrap Ironic PXE dirs like puppet does it

Add missing setype for httpboot and tftpboot directories being ensured
by host prep tasks.

Similarly to that ironic-conductor-container-puppet does, add missing
host prep task for creating tftpboot for ironic-pxe-container-puppet.

Related-Bug: #1845222

Change-Id: If25c36ad0473fa23d999bc9c39684ac524f52b1a
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

TripleO container builds are currently failing as the rabbitmq

commit_message:
ppc64le: Ensure that rabbitmq-server.repo exists before trying sed

TripleO container builds are currently failing for ppc64le as the
rabbitmq repo file doesn't exist, causing sed to fail. [0] The file not
existing is expected for TripleO image builds as these repos are
overriden in this case. [1] This patch tests that the file exists
to prevent this failure.

[0] https://centos.logs.rdoproject.org/tripleo-upstream-containers-build-master-ppc64le/1540/logs/logs/build.log
[1] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-kolla/%23openstack-kolla.2019-09-23.log.html#t2019-09-23T16:42:29

Change-Id: I7bf6d064ad8deb94a8fe53f4f4735f7b13ff27b1
Co-Authored-By: Mark Goddard <mark@stackhpc.com>

commit_message:
Set binding profile directly from OVNTrunkDriver

Setting binding profile for Trunk subports takes
time - for 125 subports rally CreateAndListTrunks
scenario [0] takes about 150 seconds. We need to
bump up the perfomance because large number of
subports is widly used in Kuryr deployments.

To achieve that I changed setting the binding
profile to be saved directly to the neutron DB.
Instead calling port_update I update only related
fields in OVN NorthBound DB rows. That gave performance
improvement in trunk port creation:

from 101 sec to 19.7 for 95%ile
from 99 sec to 14.9 for 50%ile

The same thing has been done for Trunk deletion.

[0] https://github.com/openstack/rally-openstack/blob/master/rally_openstack/scenarios/neutron/trunk.py#L37

Closes-Bug: #1834637

Conflicts:
    networking_ovn/ml2/trunk_driver.py
    networking_ovn/tests/unit/ml2/test_trunk_driver.py

Change-Id: I020ba64618b2eb76c627632b0575896e88d1fcf8
(cherry picked from commit 41f6d622abc65ca4c10b08f8c022915df2809255)

commit_message:
Set binding profile directly from OVNTrunkDriver

Setting binding profile for Trunk subports takes
time - for 125 subports rally CreateAndListTrunks
scenario [0] takes about 150 seconds. We need to
bump up the perfomance because large number of
subports is widly used in Kuryr deployments.

To achieve that I changed setting the binding
profile to be saved directly to the neutron DB.
Instead calling port_update I update only related
fields in OVN NorthBound DB rows. That gave performance
improvement in trunk port creation:

from 101 sec to 19.7 for 95%ile
from 99 sec to 14.9 for 50%ile

The same thing has been done for Trunk deletion.

[0] https://github.com/openstack/rally-openstack/blob/master/rally_openstack/scenarios/neutron/trunk.py#L37

Closes-Bug: #1834637

Conflicts:
    networking_ovn/ml2/trunk_driver.py
    networking_ovn/tests/unit/ml2/test_trunk_driver.py

Change-Id: I020ba64618b2eb76c627632b0575896e88d1fcf8
(cherry picked from commit 843200b9ce710d6973c0308b1b976a065efd6ce3)

Setting binding profile for Trunk subports takes
time - for 125 subports rally CreateAndListTrunks
scenario [0] takes about 150 seconds. We need to
bump up the perfomance because large number of
subports is widly used in Kuryr deployments.

profile to be saved directly to the neutron DB.

commit_message:
Set binding profile directly from OVNTrunkDriver

Setting binding profile for Trunk subports takes
time - for 125 subports rally CreateAndListTrunks
scenario [0] takes about 150 seconds. We need to
bump up the perfomance because large number of
subports is widly used in Kuryr deployments.

To achieve that I changed setting the binding
profile to be saved directly to the neutron DB.
Instead calling port_update I update only related
fields in OVN NorthBound DB rows. That gave performance
improvement in trunk port creation:

from 101 sec to 19.7 for 95%ile
from 99 sec to 14.9 for 50%ile

The same thing has been done for Trunk deletion.

[0] https://github.com/openstack/rally-openstack/blob/master/rally_openstack/scenarios/neutron/trunk.py#L37

Closes-Bug: #1834637

Change-Id: I020ba64618b2eb76c627632b0575896e88d1fcf8

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-25 14:51:11.000000000', 'message': 'Run DIB with tracing enabled and increase the DHCP timeout

We seem to be hitting occasional failures to DHCP in time, although

commit_message:
Run DIB with tracing enabled and increase the DHCP timeout

We seem to be hitting occasional failures to DHCP in time, although
DHCP itself seems working. Try increasing timeout from 30 to 60.

Also enable tracing when building the image, so that this sort of
issues is a bit easier to debug without unpacking the image.

Change-Id: If3f00ba39daf72739802c46c5c6c64cfbb6ab0ae

commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/train

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/train branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I5dbea870d65d970db2be5a021c3bc18f730f4dc1

commit_message:
Don't use configuration options in function signatures

This causes the values to be evaluated at import time, which makes
it harder to import such modules in functional tests.

Change-Id: I1fc69058f737ef3ab9e703968d05a2d77fc57fdb

[{'created': '2019-09-24 22:23:07.000000000', 'message': 'Make proxy honor raise_exc in REST primitives

Previously, invoking a REST primitive (.get(), .put(), etc.) on a proxy
would ignore the raise_exc kwarg and always use raise_exc=False, causing
any error coming from the actual service [1] to return a Response object
even for responses with status >=400.

With this change, the raise_exc kwarg is honored: when True, REST
primitives with status >=400 will cause an appropriate ksa exception to
be raised.

[1] as opposed to lower level e.g. communication errors, which would
still raise

Change-Id: I463e9a63760a6e61827ba957dd9e5d23bd79f4e8

With this change, the raise_exc kwarg is honored: when True, REST

still raise

Change-Id: I463e9a63760a6e61827ba957dd9e5d23bd79f4e8

commit_message:
Make proxy honor raise_exc in REST primitives

Previously, invoking a REST primitive (.get(), .put(), etc.) on a proxy
would ignore the raise_exc kwarg and always use raise_exc=False, causing
any error coming from the actual service [1] to return a Response object
even for responses with status >=400.

With this change, the raise_exc kwarg is honored: when True, REST
primitives with status >=400 will cause an appropriate ksa exception to
be raised.

[1] as opposed to lower level e.g. communication errors, which would
still raise

Change-Id: I463e9a63760a6e61827ba957dd9e5d23bd79f4e8

commit_message:
Add warning about Ceph RBD journal overhead

Enabling RBD mirroring makes use of the journal feature of RBD's.

This has some significant overheads for write performance so
make sure this is apparent in the documentation for this feature.

Change-Id: I0e10d641606e25f6711d07eed75ba23214ec9bd7
